00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodRunReport.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Jul 28 12:12:05 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Summarize and output basic statistics on the performance of
00028  * a particular summarization or detection method across a number of
00029  * cel files.
00030  */
00031

00040 using namespace affx;

00042 /** Constructor. */
00043 QuantMethodRunReport::QuantMethodRunReport(const std::vector<std::string> &chipNames) {
00044   m_ChipNames = chipNames;
00045 }

00047 bool QuantMethodRunReport::prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00048     return true;
00049 }
00050 
00051 /** 
00052  * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00053  * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00054  * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00055  * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00056  * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00057  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00058  */  
00059 bool QuantMethodRunReport::report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantMethod &qMethod,
00060                                   const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00061                                   PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00062   // Nothing to do as we cull stats from the ChipSummary interface
00063   return true;
00064 }
00065 
00066 /** Print out our stats as a tab delmited text file. */
00067 bool QuantMethodRunReport::finish() {
00068   // There are two passes here: 1) determine what columns we are going to 
00069   // print and outputting their headers. 2) Loop through all of the 
00070   // cel files and output their statistics.
00071   
00072   // Here are the column headers.
00073 
00074   // Column for cel file names.
00075   int cidx = 0;
00076   defineStringColumn(0, cidx++, "cel_files",TSVREPORT_CELFILE_STRLEN);
00077   
00078   // Column for each metric
00079   for(int source=0; source<m_ChipSummaries.size(); source++) {
00080     addHeaderComments(m_ChipSummaries[source]->getHeaderComments());
00081     ChipSummary::metricDefVec_t metricdefs=m_ChipSummaries[source]->getMetricDefs();
00082     for(int m=0; m<metricdefs.size(); m++) {
00083       if(metricdefs[m].m_type == ChipSummary::Metric::Integer) {
00084         defineColumn(0, cidx, metricdefs[m].m_name,affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00085       }
00086       else if (metricdefs[m].m_type == ChipSummary::Metric::Double) {
00087         defineColumn(0, cidx, metricdefs[m].m_name,affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
00088         int p=metricdefs[m].m_precision;
00089         if (p>0) {
00090           setPrecision(0, cidx, p);
00091         }
00092       } 
00093       else if (metricdefs[m].m_type == ChipSummary::Metric::String) {
00094         defineStringColumn(0, cidx, metricdefs[m].m_name,TSVREPORT_METRIC_STRLEN);
00095       }
00096       else {
00097         Err::errAbort("QuantMethodRunReport: Unable to handle unknown type: " + ToStr(metricdefs[m].m_type) );
00098       }
00099       // next col
00100       cidx++;
00101     }
00102   }
00103 
00104   // Meta Info and Comments
00105 //  std::vector<std::string>::iterator keysIx;
00106 //  std::vector<std::string>::iterator valsIx;
00107 //  for(keysIx = m_HeaderKeys.begin(), valsIx = m_HeaderVals.begin();
00108 //      keysIx != m_HeaderKeys.end() && valsIx != m_HeaderVals.end();
00109 //      ++keysIx, ++valsIx) {
00110 //    addHeader(*keysIx, *valsIx);
00111 //  }
00112 //  for(valsIx = m_OtherLines.begin(); valsIx != m_OtherLines.end(); ++valsIx) {
00113 //          tsv.addHeaderComment(*valsIx);
00114 //  }
00115 
00116   // Initialize the file
00117   writeTsv_v1();
00118   
00119   // Print the statistics for each individual chip.
00120   for(uint32_t chipIx = 0; chipIx < (uint32_t)m_ChipNames.size(); ++chipIx) {
00121     int count = 0;
00122     std::vector<CumulativeStats<double> >::iterator celProbeStatsIx;
00123     
00124     // cel file name
00125     set_string(0, count++, Fs::basename(m_ChipNames[chipIx]));
00126 
00127     // Chip Summary metrics
00128     for(int source=0; source<m_ChipSummaries.size(); source++) {
00129       std::vector<ChipSummary::Metric> metrics = m_ChipSummaries[source]->getMetrics(chipIx);
00130       for(int m=0; m<metrics.size(); m++) {
00131         if (metrics[m].m_Type == ChipSummary::Metric::Integer) {
00132           set_i(0, count, metrics[m].m_Integer);
00133         } 
00134         else if (metrics[m].m_Type == ChipSummary::Metric::Double) {
00135           set_d(0, count, metrics[m].m_Double);
00136         } 
00137         else if(metrics[m].m_Type == ChipSummary::Metric::String) {
00138           set_string(0, count, metrics[m].m_String);
00139         } else {
00140           Err::errAbort("QuantMethodRunReport: Unable to handle unknown type: " + ToStr(metrics[m].m_Type) );
00141         }
00142         // next col
00143         count++;
00144       }
00145     }
00146     writeLevel(0);
00147   }
00148   close();
00149 
00150   return true;
00151 }
00152 
00153 void QuantMethodRunReport::registerChipSummary(ChipSummary *summary) {
00154       m_ChipSummaries.push_back(summary);
00155 }
